programme.title: Alaska: Mysteries Unsolved
programme.desc: Investigating whether a massive, ferocious white bear, reminiscent of the Bear God Torngarsuk, is responsible for the disappearance of an entire Alaskan village 60 years ago.

programme.title: Counting Cars
programme.desc: Motorcycle lover Sharon has not been comfortable on a bike since she lost her leg, so Danny and the crew build a bike for her and her partner that is safe, comfortable and 'cool'.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Back in Santa Ana, the buyers face 10 vaults belonging to the same owner. Dave snaps up almost half of them, while Ivy draws a nice profit out of his. But in the end, Mary and Kenny end up doing all the heavy lifting.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Stanton, California, Dave learns that making a profit is sometimes like pulling teeth, Mary grinds to get into the black, while Ivy's locker ends up sucking and blowing.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Man in Black Is Back in Black
programme.desc: Dave Hester returns to the auction circuit, Darrell tries to get Brandon into shape, and Jarrod and Brandi's latest purchase leads them on a wild ride.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Rob Beckett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Extended version of a 2007 edition of the satirical current affairs quiz, presented by Kirsty Young. Former Labour politician Bob Marshall-Andrews and Dr Phil Hammond join regular team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton.

programme.title: Rhod Gilbert's Work Experience
programme.desc: The stand-up comedian tries out being a teacher at Monnow Primary School in Bettws, Gwent. However, 'Mr Gilbert' soon feels the pressure as he tries to impress his colleagues and the children in his class.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Vigilantes try to rid their neighbourhoods of criminals and addicts in the Philippines. In a city slum, police embark on a night-time operation that leads to dozens of arrests.

programme.title: Drug Wars
programme.desc: Isis tries to take control of Mindanao, home to the largest Muslim community in the Philippines - and it turns out the terrorist group is being funded by illegal drugs.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Hidden Traces
programme.desc: Archaeologists examine important sites from past conflicts, beginning with Adolf Hitler's Bavarian mountain retreat at Obersalzberg.

programme.title: Hidden Traces
programme.desc: Archaeological findings from the First World War, with expert accounts and animated reconstructions.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is adjusting to life on her own after her father's wedding. She is engaged to Dr Marsham, but still unsure whether this is the right thing to do.

programme.title: Birds of a Feather
programme.desc: The pace of Christmas proves too much for Sharon as a few too many slices of chocolate cake sends her off into a dream world where she is the rich member of the family, happily married to rock star husband Chris, while sister Tracey is a downtrodden housewife in a run-down council flat and man-eating neighbour Dorien her dowdy cleaning lady. Festive edition of the comedy from 1994, starring Pauline Quirke, Linda Robson and Lesley Joseph, with a guest appearance by film-maker Michael Winner.

credits.actor: a guest appearance by film-maker Michael Winner

programme.title: Lost in Care
programme.desc: We hear from young people whose lives have been changed forever by being in care. From drugs, self-harm and mental health issues, is enough being done to protect the most vulnerable?.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.sub-title: Hotspots: On the Frontline - Remembering The Arab Spring
programme.desc: Alex Crawford and Stuart Ramsay look back at their coverage of the Arab Spring 10 years on, culminating in exclusive reporting of the collapse of Gaddafi's regime in Libya.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: Let Magic be the soundtrack to your late night listening with some of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Hot Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: Check out this mix of the biggest videos and the hottest new hits right now.

programme.title: Jeremy Wade's Dark Waters
programme.desc: Fisherman and adventurer Jeremy Wade travels to Lake Garda in northern Italy to investigate rumours of a 16th-century monster fish deep within.

programme.title: Blowing Up History
programme.desc: The Egyptian site of Karnak was once the ancient world's largest religious complex. Human remains tell the story of a new religion that changed Egypt.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and Vinnie venture into enemy territory to pick up the Black Widow bike, while Paul Sr is frustrated he has not seen Mikey since the settlement.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex tackles a foosball (aka fussball) table that is badly weathered. Martin works on a stagecoach trunk, while Craig revamps a Scandinavian chair.

programme.title: Mighty Ships
programme.desc: The Ibn Battuta, named after the Moroccan explorer, which is one of the strongest dredgers of its type, and capable of breaking up the hardest subsea soil.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How coffee machines, mascots, hammocks and traditional bows are made, and the ways in which manufacturing processes have been affected by technological progress.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How glass fibre insulation, bubblegum machines and exhaust systems are made and the ways in which these methods have progressed as technology has developed.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: A woman is mysteriously abducted in Colorado, and it is not long before the police are investigating her murder.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of 24-year-old former cheerleader Amy Lord. CCTV footage from ATMs and outside her home captured the moment she was taken by her killer.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: When Robert O'Dubaine was found shot to death in 1993, an apparent gangland hit unravelled into a case of betrayal, which directed the FBI on a hunt for his fiancee Catherine Suh, a lethal temptress dubbed the Black Widow by the media.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Investigator McHugh tries to save a dog that has strayed onto a motorway, then helps a Chihuahua with a spinal injury.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: When Boris the Staffy was born he had a cleft palate, and Chris attempts a type of complex surgery that has never been performed in the country before to help save his life.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Heather's fiance acts like a drill sergeant when picking out dresses and the bride soon becomes frustrated with his bad attitude.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: A Boys School With A Dark Past & More

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets tasks to comics including Mel Giedroyc and Noel Fielding, with Alex Horne and Noel Fielding dancing like a pair of shrews.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a car auction business. A near-perfect 50s Chevy panel van and a very desirable low-mileage 80s Brooklands Capri tempt auctioneer Derek out of Yorkshire.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Penny gives Hugh an ultimatum about their relationship, while Meryl and Betty land Hugh as their star attraction at the first Whyhope speed dating night.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: News, Sport, Weather
programme.desc: Round-up of the latest news and sports headlines, plus weather forecasts.

programme.title: John Bishop's Great Whale Rescue
programme.desc: Part two of two. John's mission to return Little White and Little Grey from captivity to the Icelandic beluga whale sanctuary continues, as the pair begin the 6,000-mile journey to reach their new home. Following the previous delays in China, the release is already two months behind schedule, and as autumn approaches the whales have little time to put on enough weight and acclimatise to the cold water they will face in the bay.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: Let Magic be the soundtrack to your late night listening with some of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Ed Stafford: Into the Unknown
programme.desc: The renowned British explorer sets out to find the cause of some mysterious white lines in what appears to be an uninhabited area of swamp on Kimaam Island, Indonesia.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: When a killer's dumping ground is discovered in Florida, investigators set out to confirm the identity of charred bones in order to solve the brutal crime.
